column2: Wall Assembly
column8: A1-A3 Global Warming Potential (or Embodied Carbon Coefficient) (kgCO2e/m3)
column9: Total A1-A3 GWP for the Material (kgCO2e)
column10: Total A1-A3 GWP for the Assembly (kgCO2e/m3)
column11: Total A1-A3 GWP for the Assembly (kgCO2e/m2 wall area)
column14: Assumption(s) and Source

column2: 6 in Solid Masonry (CMU) Wall
column14: Assume a 2 meter by 2 meter wall. Roughly 50 CMU blocks are needed to construct this wall

column2: 6 in Solid Masonry (CMU) Wall
column14: Assume: Based on NW1 classification and density of 125 pcf  from CMHA EPD (https://www.masonryandhardscapes.org/sustainability/)

column2: 6 in Solid Masonry (CMU) Wall
column14: Assume: 3000 psi 0% FA/slag used as proxy from NRMCA EPD (https://www.nrmca.org/wp-content/uploads/2022/03/NRMCA_EPDV3-2_20220301.pdf)

column2: 8 in Solid Masonry (CMU) Wall with furring - 1-7/8in cavity with duct liner and 1 layer of 5/8in GWB
8 in Solid Masonry (CMU) Wall with furring - 1-7/8in cavity with duct liner and 1 layer of 5/8in GWB
column14: Assume: 1 furring per 16 in spacing (CMU), so roughly 10 furring channels. Use Clark Dietrich 20 Gage Drywall Furring Channel. Ref: ClarkDietrich, Environmental Product Declaration (EPD) for Cold-Formed Steel Framing Systems (ClarkDietrich, West Chester, OH, 2020)

column2: 8 in Solid Masonry (CMU) Wall with furring - 1-7/8in cavity with duct liner and 1 layer of 5/8in GWB
column14: Assume: 1 layer of 5/8in GWP on each side. Use the Gypsum Association's EPD (https://www.usg.com/content/dam/USG_Marketing_Communications/united_states/product_promotional_materials/finished_assets/2020-type-x-wallboard-epd-en.pdf)

column2: 8 in Solid Masonry (CMU) Wall with a 1 in airspace on each side and 4in studs on each side and 2 layers of 5/8in GWP on each side
